snippet: The Republican establishment closes ranks around a smaller number of candidates, but can Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio build on their Iowa momentum?
abstract: Republican opponents of Donald J Trump begin aggressively challenging him in New Hampshire, energized by stinging defeat he suffered in Iowa; loss provides hope to Republicans hoping to shrink his lead in second primary state; race between Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders intensifies after Clinton's narrow defeat of Sanders in Iowa.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Maggie Haberman and Alan Rappeport from Des Moines; Jess Bidgood from Newbury N.H.; Ashley Parker from Manchester; and Steve Eder from Nashua, N.H.

lead_paragraph: The Republican establishment closes ranks around a smaller number of candidates, but can Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio build on their Iowa momentum?

headline.main: Rivals Look to New Hampshire for a Shot at Breaking Donald Trump’s Stride
headline.print_headline: Challengers Are Energized by Trump’s Loss in Iowa
